all.name: Irving Harper Works in Paper
all.description: Known for his mid-century creation of the Marshmallow Sofa, Ball Clock, and Herman Miller logo as George Nelson Associates' director of design, Irving Harper made hundreds of rarely seen paper sculptures in his spare time from 1963-2000. Hardcover. 176 pages.

all.name: Hella Jongerius: I Don't Have a Favourite Colour
Reproducing Scholten & Baijings
all.description: The first monograph on Dutch design duo Stefan Scholten and Carole Baijings takes an in-depth look at their research-intensive, hands-on, and iterative approach to making as demonstrated across seven case studies including those with 1616/Arita Japan, MINI, Georg Jensen, and Maharam. Hardcover. 348 pages.

all.name: Studio Job & The Graninger Museum
all.description: The book traces a recent survey at the Groninger Museum in the Netherlands featuring 10 years of work by Job Smeets and Nynke Tynagel, including the Bavaria Marquette series and Ruins on the end pages. Hardcover.

all.name: Irma Boom: Colour Based on Nature
all.description: Colour Based on Nature takes the concept of Irma Booms previous work further afield, highlighting UNESCO World Heritage sites across the globe and on every continent.

all.name: Jacob Hashimoto: Selected Kite Works & Installations
all.description: Colour Based on Nature takes the concept of Irma Booms previous work further afield, highlighting UNESCO World Heritage sites across the globe and on every continent.
